alert.note: Alert for Mason (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 10:35PM CDT until May 08 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble and Mason. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 PM CDT, radar indicated heavy rain with a band of thunderstorms extending from northern and western Mason County, into southwestern Kimble County. This band of storms was nearly stationary. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches in a short period of time will cause minor flooding, and flooding of low-lying areas. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, Mason, Yates Crossing, London, Streeter, Grit, Segovia, South Llano River State Park, Art, Telegraph and Koockville. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 452 and 469. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River, Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, US HWY 377 crossing 2 miles North of Telegraph, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, CR 150 crossing South Llano River, Old Katemcy Mason crossing Comanche Creek, Behrens School crossing Comanche Creek and Oak Grove crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
